content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(-3.5, 27.5) with drop position Position(-3.5, 28.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5).
– Dedicated factory burner inserter positioned at Position(3.5, 17.5), whose neighbour links include a burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5) and an assembling-machine-1 at Position(1.5, 19.5).

### Belt Depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest placed at Position(3.5, 15.5) serving as the depot.
– Transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(4.5, 15.5).
– Dedicated depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP adjacent to the depot chest).

### Electricity Generator at Position(-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– Steam Engine (generator) at Position(-0.5, 24.5).
– Boiler at Position(-5.5, 24.0).
– Offshore pump at Position(-7.5, 25.5).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
– Transport Belt Connection Errors:
 • Do not attempt to connect transport belts directly to a steam-engine (Prototype.SteamEngine object). Always route the belt to an inserter that feeds the engine.
 
– Placement Range Errors:
 • When a placement error indicates the target is too far (e.g. wooden-chest at (3.5,15.5) with player at (0,0)), move closer so that the target position is within the permissible range.
 
– Undefined Variable Errors:
 • Ensure that all referenced variables (for example, 'target_chest') are properly defined before use to avoid NameError issues.
 
– Inventory Shortage Errors:
 • Before placing an entity (such as a wooden chest), verify that the item is available in the inventory.
